summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from August-September 2019 between FBI and Federal Protective Service personnel regarding access to video footage (CCV) from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) for a specific case. The emails discuss requesting access to review footage from specific dates to understand what is available for their investigation.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.role: Special Agent, Federal Bureau of Investigation, New York Office
persons.context: The primary correspondent requesting access to MCC video footage for case review. Appears in multiple emails in the chain.

persons.name: FBI NY CART Coordinator
persons.context: Responds to an access request, stating they are not part of the case and referring the requester to another contact.

persons.name: Special Agent Federal Protective Service
persons.role: Special Agent, Federal Protective Service, U.S. Department of Homeland Security, Task Force Officer FBI New York Field Office
persons.context: Sends the initial request to review MCC visitation footage for specific dates related to case 90C-NY-3154599, noting they will be on leave.

connections.description: The Special Agent contacts the CART Coordinator for status/access to MCC video systems; the Coordinator responds and refers them elsewhere.
Both are law enforcement agents corresponding about access to video footage for case investigations, indicating inter-agency collaboration.

events.title: Initial Request for MCC Video Footage Review
events.description: A Special Agent with the Federal Protective Service sends a request to review MCC visitation footage from specific dates (5/31, 6/14, 6/21, 7/5, 7/26, 8/7, 8/14) for case 90C-NY-3154599.

events.title: Follow-up on Access to MCC Video System
events.description: Multiple emails are exchanged on September 5, 2019, as FBI Special Agents follow up on obtaining access (TTK/ITIC) to the MCC video system for case # 282B-NY-3156749.

keyFacts: Law enforcement was actively seeking video footage from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) visitation areas on specific dates in 2019 (May 31, June 14, June 21, July 5, July 26, August 7, August 14).
The request for footage was related to at least two case numbers: 90C-NY-3154599 and 282B-NY-3156749.
Access to the video system required specific permissions (TTK/ITIC access), and training was potentially needed.
The correspondence shows coordination between the FBI New York Office and the Federal Protective Service (Department of Homeland Security) regarding this investigative review.
The timeline of emails (August 23 to September 5, 2019) coincides with the period Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated at the MCC prior to his death.
